bibl.title: Henry Imhoff v. LV Wyckoff. Orginal Court Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: Territory of Washington Third Judicial District SS
The United States of America To the sheriff or jailor of King County United States Marshall of Wash Terry
div1.p:
Whereas Henry Imhoff has been charged upon oath before me, the undersigned a United States Commissioner duly appointed by the Supreme Court of the Territory of Washington, with having committed an offense against the laws of the United States, in this: that on the 18 day of September AD 1881, at Litha Territory of Alaska the said Henry Imhoff did then + there sell, give + dispose of intoxicating liquor to writ: beer to certain indivdual, to writ Aushorts Coltson, Percey Percey's wife, Callahan's wife, Gochsin then + there being contrary to the statutes in such made + provided + against the peace + deputy of the United States. And After an exmination had this day by me of the witness against the said Henry Imhoff is appeasing to me that the said offence has been committed and that there is probable cause to believe the said Henry Imhoff to be guilty of the offence thus charged and the said Henry Imhoff not having offered sufficent bail as required by me, the said commissioner in the sum of $3.00 dollars for his appearance at the next regular terms of the District Court of the United States, for
the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, to be holden at the United States court room in the city of seattle on the ___, to answer for the said offense was by me then and there ordered to be committed to the Med. Pennitentory at McMalls Island WA for want of surities and until he should be discharged by due course of law.

You are therefore hereby commanded in the name and by the authority of the United States of America to recieve the said Henry Imhoff, and him safely keep until he shall have been delievered by due process of law.
div1.ab: Given under my hand and seal this 1st day of November AD 1881 James P Ludlow SS US Commissioner as aforesaid
No 16 U S. Commissioner James P Ludlow Seattle Wash Tery United States vs Henry Imhoff Commitment Copy
